intro: Westringia grevillina, commonly known as Grevillea westringia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in well-drained soils. It is well-suited for coastal gardens due to its tolerance of salt spray and drought conditions. The flowers are borne in clusters and attract native pollinators such as bees and birds.
